byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

abstract: Controversy over Hillary Rodham Clinton's use of personal email address for State Department communications is focused on three distinct phases: her decision to use private account, destruction of messages deemed to be personal and discovery of classified information in some official emails; questions remain as to why private account was used, what criteria was used to decide which messages to destroy and exactly what classified information was found by government inspectors.
lead_paragraph: The former secretary of state’s email account has become a significant early chapter in her run for the presidency and a new element of her evolving portrait.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Emails Take Long Path to Controversy
headline.print_headline: Clinton Emails Took Long Path to Controversy

snippet: The former secretary of state’s email account has become a significant early chapter in her run for the presidency and a new element of her evolving portrait.
